predictions.text: ISM Services PMI (U.S., headline) for November 2025 will print between 50.0 and 52.5.
predictions.verification_criteria: Use the Institute for Supply Management 'Services PMI' headline index in the ISM Report On Business for November 2025 (first release). Range inclusive.
evidence: U.S. services activity has been more resilient than manufacturing in recent months.
Cooling inflation and steady employment support modest services expansion.
S&P Global U.S. Services PMI levels have hovered near expansion territory.
monitoring_signals: S&P Global U.S. Services PMI final reading
High-frequency card spend and airline/TSA throughput
Regional Fed services surveys (e.g., Richmond, Dallas)
predictions.rationale: Services momentum remains modest; no sharp demand shock signaled.

predictions.text: ISM Services Prices Index for November 2025 will print between 56.0 and 60.5.
predictions.verification_criteria: Use ISM Report On Business: Services 'Prices' subindex for November 2025 (first release). Range inclusive.
evidence: Services input cost pressures have cooled but remain above neutral.
Energy prices off highs reduce broad cost pass-through.
Moderating wage growth tempers price momentum.
monitoring_signals: Wage indicators (Atlanta Fed Wage Growth Tracker)
predictions.rationale: Prices still above 50 amid sticky services inflation, but subdued.

predictions.text: ADP National Employment Report will show U.S. private payrolls rose between +100,000 and +200,000 in November 2025.
predictions.verification_criteria: Use headline 'Change in Total Nonfarm Private Employment' in ADP National Employment Report for November 2025 (first release). Range inclusive.
evidence: Hiring has slowed from earlier peaks but remains positive.
Small business hiring cooling, large firms comparatively steadier.
Seasonal retail hiring offsets goods-sector softness.
monitoring_signals: Indeed job postings and vacancy trends
predictions.rationale: Labor market cooling but not collapsing supports a mid-range ADP gain.

predictions.text: Seasonally adjusted U.S. Continuing Claims (Insured Unemployment) will print at or above 1.90 million in at least one Weekly Claims report released by 2025-12-31.
predictions.verification_criteria: Use 'Insured Unemployment (SA)' level from DOL Unemployment Insurance Weekly Claims press release; any report published by 2025-12-31 qualifies. Threshold inclusive.
evidence: Continuing claims trended higher through autumn, signaling a loosening labor market.
Longer job searches and seasonal layoffs into December often lift insured unemployment.
Hiring frictions persist in some sectors.
monitoring_signals: Temporary help employment in monthly payrolls
predictions.rationale: Claims trend has drifted up; seasonal factors could push above 1.9m.

predictions.text: The Federal Reserve will leave the federal funds target range unchanged at its December 2025 FOMC meeting.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verify via the FOMC post-meeting statement on the Federal Reserve website; 'target range' identical to the preceding meeting. Any intra-meeting action before the statement voids this prediction.
evidence: Inflation has eased toward target while growth cools.
Financial conditions do not necessitate an immediate change.
Recent Fed communications emphasize patience and data dependence.
monitoring_signals: FOMC speakers’ guidance prior to blackout
predictions.rationale: Macro cooling argues for holding to assess trajectory.

predictions.text: The Bank of England will leave Bank Rate unchanged at its December 2025 MPC meeting.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verify via the Bank of England MPC statement/minutes; Bank Rate equals the pre-meeting level. First announcement governs.
evidence: UK inflation is easing but remains above target.
Growth softness and housing sensitivity argue for caution.
MPC communications point to a patient stance.
monitoring_signals: UK CPI and wage growth releases
predictions.rationale: Inflation trend improving; premature cuts unlikely; hold likely.

predictions.text: COMEX Gold front-month futures will settle at or above $2,450.00 per troy ounce on at least one trading day by 2025-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Use CME Group official settlement for the active COMEX Gold (GC) front-month contract as reported by CME or major data vendors. Threshold inclusive.
evidence: Lower real yields and hedging demand can support gold.
Sustained central bank buying underpins bullion demand.
Momentum near highs raises breakout odds.
predictions.rationale: Supportive macro and positioning leave upside tail risk.

predictions.text: BTC/USD spot will trade at or above $80,000 on at least one UTC day by 2025-12-31.
predictions.verification_criteria: Any reputable exchange (e.g., Coinbase, Kraken) or aggregator (CoinMarketCap/CoinGecko) showing an intraday high ≥ $80,000 (UTC) suffices. Spot market only.
evidence: Crypto markets can exhibit strong momentum into year-end.
Institutional participation via ETFs has grown.
Easier macro/liquidity expectations can buoy digital assets.
monitoring_signals: Perpetuals funding rates and open interest
predictions.rationale: Momentum-driven assets can spike into year-end.

predictions.text: USD/JPY spot will trade at or below 145.00 on at least one UTC day by 2025-12-31.
predictions.verification_criteria: Using widely cited FX data (Bloomberg, Refinitiv, TradingView), an intraday low ≤ 145.00 (UTC) satisfies. Spot market, not futures.
evidence: Softer U.S. yields can weigh on the dollar.
BoJ normalization risk supports episodic JPY strength.
Crowded USD/JPY positioning is prone to squeezes.
predictions.rationale: Rates convergence risk invites USD/JPY downside tests.

predictions.text: Euro area (EA20) seasonally adjusted unemployment rate for November 2025 will print between 6.5% and 6.7%.
predictions.verification_criteria: Use Eurostat press release/database for EA20 unemployment rate (SA) for November 2025 (first published value). Range inclusive.
evidence: EA unemployment has hovered near historic lows with gradual drift.
Growth softness has not yet triggered sharp labor deterioration.
Historical inertia keeps monthly changes small.
monitoring_signals: Country labor reports (Germany, France, Spain, Italy)
predictions.rationale: Unemployment rate is stable with slight upward bias.

predictions.text: EIA Weekly Natural Gas Storage Report will show a Lower 48 net withdrawal of at least 100 Bcf in at least one report published by 2025-12-31.
predictions.verification_criteria: Use EIA 'Weekly Natural Gas Storage Report' table for 'Net change' (Lower 48). Any report released by 2025-12-31 with ≤ -100 Bcf qualifies. First publication counts.
evidence: December typically brings larger storage withdrawals.
Cold spells can drive triple-digit weekly draws.
Baseline storage and production shape draw potential.
monitoring_signals: Pipeline flows and dry gas production estimates
Power burn and LNG feedgas demand
predictions.rationale: Seasonal weather risk favors at least one large draw.

predictions.text: NIST NVD will publish at least 2 CVE entries with CVSS v3.x Base Score 10.0 between 2025-12-01 and 2025-12-31 (UTC), inclusive.
predictions.verification_criteria: Query NVD (nvd.nist.gov) for CVEs with 'Published' date in 2025-12-01..2025-12-31 and CVSS v3.x Base Score = 10.0. Count unique CVE IDs. Mirrors/JSON feeds acceptable.
evidence: High/critical CVEs with 10.0 scores appear regularly.
Year-end disclosures cluster around Patch Tuesday and vendor bulletins.
NVD promptly posts vendor PSIRT advisories.
predictions.rationale: Disclosure cadence suggests multiple critical 10.0 CVEs in December.
